features: Studio-grade condenser microphone that delivers premium audio performance for crystal clear audio capture - perfect for vocals, acoustic instruments, amplifiers and more
Directional cardioid polar pattern and pure-aluminum-plated, 18mm-diameter-diaphragm condenser capsule
Smooth, wide ranging frequency response (20–20,000Hz) captures the full audible spectrum
High sensitivity and low signal-to-noise ratio captures every subtle nuance of your source audio
Compact footprint and lightweight form factor for portable audio capture
body.description: The MPM-1000 is perfect for podcasting applications or capturing high-quality audio from vocalists, melodic instruments, percussion, drum kits and more. At the heart of the MPM-1000 is a 18mm pure-aluminum-plated condenser capsule with a directional cardioid polar pattern. The result? A wide-ranging frequency response (20 20,000Hz), high sensitivity (-38dB ± 2dB (0dB = 1V/Pa @ 1kHz)) and a fast-transient response that combine for premium capture and faithful recreation of every subtle nuance of a sung or narrated vocal part - all with minimal interference from unwanted ambient noise. With the MPM-1000, complicated setups are a thing of the past. Thanks to an included windscreen, a purpose-designed shock-mount for mounting to a traditional mic-stand, a tripod stand, and even an XLR cable, all the core tools for seamless connectivity are thoughtfully included for instant recording and creative potential. When combined with low self-noise (17dBA) and signal-to-noise ratio (77dB) specifications, pristine audio capture is assured every time.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: MPM-1000 - Superior Studio Sound Whatever you want to record, guaranteeing the best sound possible doesn't get easier than this. MPM-1000 is the perfect solution for podcasting, vlogging, gaming or studio-grade recording that fuses studio-quality sound with everything you need to start recording right out the box.

Capture Every Detail At the heart of the MPM-1000 is a 18mm condenser capsule with a wide ranging frequency response, high sensitivity, and a fast transient response that combine for pristine studio-quality recording. Keeping Your Recording On Point With MPM1000, keep your recording focused with a cardiod polar pattern that preserves isolation and prevents unwanted feedback – perfect for recording closely-spaced sources Everything you Need for Simple, Seamless Setup With an included windscreen, a shock-mount for mounting to a traditional mic-stand, a tripod stand, and even an XLR cable, all essentials for recording from the get-go are here!

XLR Connection Condenser Capsule Shockmount USB Connection Boom Arm Volume control XLR Connection Condenser Capsule Shockmount USB Connection Boom Arm Volume control XLR Connection Condenser Capsule Shockmount USB Connection Boom Arm Volume control XLR Connection Condenser Capsule Shockmount USB Connection Boom Arm Volume control

What's Included in the box? - MPM-1000 - Custom windscreen - Shock mount - Desktop tripod stand - XLR cable Do I need phantom power? Yes - The MPM-1000 is a standard condenser microphone and will require 48vDC power, supplied either by phantom power through an audio interface, mixer, or through an external phantom power supply. How can I find out if my mixer or audio interface can supply phantom power? Check the specifications for your mixer or audio interface to find out if it can provide phantom power on its own, or if you will need to supply this through an external adapter. How should I connect this microphone to my setup? (Part 1) - Make sure that the gain or volume on your pre-amp, speakers and headphones are all turned down - Make sure that Phantom Power on your Mixer, Audio Interface or external power source is switched off How should I connect this microphone to my setup? (Part 2) - Use the supplied XLR cable and attach the female end securely to the MPM-1000. Connect the male end to your XLR cable to your pre-amp or phantom power supply. - Once the MPM-1000 is fully connected to the pre-amp, turn on the phantom power.

The included mount won't fit on my microphone stand. Is it compatible? (Part 1) The MPM-1000 comes with a thread adapter that may come left inside the shock mount and can be easy to overlook. This can be used to adapt the microphone to fit on microphone stands with different threading. The included mount won't fit on my microphone stand. Is it compatible? (Part 2) Most often this is associated with a difference in microphone stands between the US (5/8" threading, without the adapter) and Europe (3/8" threading, with the adapter). The adapter can be removed or re-inserted using a flat head screwdriver. I need help - How can I contact Marantz Professional support? If you have any pre/after-sales questions, the Marantz Pro support team are available to help! To connect directly with our Amazon Support team, please email - amzsupport @ marantzpro.com

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Marantz still means quality.
reviews.reviewText: I couldn't believe that anything could be wrong with a Marantz microphone, and I am still not. There is nothing wrong with this one. I do NOT like the way Amazon does some of this review thing. I rated it excellent for gaming although I do not game because I cannot imagine why it would not be good for that purpose unless it would be because of it's size or basic configuration. It is the same thing for rating it for beginners. If you are a complete beginner to the use of this type of microphone or devoid of any technical ability it could be a challenge. Otherwise, it is perfectly simple to se and has outstanding quality for my use as a recording mic. Microphone use is a complicated and thoroughly technical issue and thus mic is a great one. This is especially so due to it's reasonable price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sound quality is remarkable.
reviews.reviewText: I tested it with FocusRite Scarlett 2i2. I plugged it into the XLR input, and then turned 48V Phantom Power button on, which is required for the condenser microphone to work.The silence is pure, when you don't talk or sing or breathe into the mic.The sound quality is remarkable. It makes your own voice sound so clear and detailed, that it builds your confidence while singing. I was directly monitoring the recording on the headphones plugged into the Audio Interface = Scarlett 2i2, so there is zero latency, which is a must for the performer to have feedback of his/her voice without any delay..The microphone doesn't pick up the street noises or even the rain just 1 meter behind me. The ceiling fan doesn't cause any noise or interference either. The laptop electronic components also have no interference on the recorded sound. I used the included XLR cable, and I don't even think you need to buy a better XLR cable.The mini tripod is not the best, but it can hold the microphone on the table once you balance it with the leg running next to the cable (consider buying a desk mountable arm straight away).The included wind foam cover also works very well, it eliminated any wind noise, and also reduced the breathing in sound (you need to move your head away from the mic when you take a breathe during performance).I am extremely satisfied with the quality of this reasonably priced microphone. It is not exaggerated to use the word PRO in its name.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great buy for beginners
reviews.reviewText: Marantz is, for all intensive purposes, a professional audio company. Please understand that this microphone is solely meant for entry level consumption.That being said, this microphone is great in a lot of ways, and doesn't really fall short anywhere for the price. The build is all aluminum, which will provide solid and rigid integrity. This microphone is a condenser microphone, and will require an audio interface with 48v phantom power in order to operate. From what I can tell, the advertised specs are spot on. It has crystal clear audio in the mid ranges, and a good range of frequency. Low/bass sounds are a little dry, and higher frequencies like those from a flute are also a bit empty sounding, but not to a degree where they distort or lose their identity.The microphone has a good weight to it, and all the added periferals are of good quality. They all feel well constructed and work as one would expect. While the mic has a good hefty feeling, it is a bit lighter than higher prices microphones.The best use case for this microphone would definitely be for voice. This would be great for podcasts, light midrange vocals, and in my case, narration and reporting. It would also be the best mic for gaming or streaming for the price.It is a solid entry level product and I look forward to personally testing their higher quality products as my career grows.TL;DR - would I recommend it? Yes, yes I would.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality for the price.
reviews.reviewText: I highly encourage anyone looking for a mic less than $200 with the ability to record from XLR to purchase the MPM-1000.Great, amazing, awesome. Only some of the adjectives that begin to describe the quality of this mic. To date this is the best mic I have worked within and outside its price range. Only thing that starts beating them are true professional quality mics, typically hand-made or expensive. I purchased two after looking at the reviews for my wife's podcast she has started. I was blown away by the quality. We spent over an hour having a conversation through these mics through headphone monitors and were vastly surprised at the clarity of our voices. It required little EQ and compression in post-production to have a professional broadcast sound.I will say the shock mounts and desktop stands are terrible. Do not expect anything from either. But, those are easily replaced. I recommend replacing them as soon as you can afford it so this mic can shine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good microphone for the money, works great with Roland Go:Mixer Pro-X
reviews.reviewText: For $50 you get the mic, decent length of XLR cable, and a pretty nice mic stand. This mic needs 48V Phantom Power so your mixer needs to provide that. I used a Roland Go:Mixer Pro-X and it worked very well. The sound is good and the mic itself looks to be well built and shoudl last a long time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect fot the price
reviews.reviewText: This is gold just for the quality and price relation, Im used to use this when im outside my main set combined with an M-Track DUO, its just perfect considering how cheap they are and the quality they bring to the table

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than my old mic.
reviews.reviewText: Good product for the price if you're wanting something decent to start with I guess. I'm no professional, but I enjoy hearing and sounding good enough so that it doesn't hurt my or other people's ears online. With a little compressor and noise removal tweaks it makes me sound pretty good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: not a good sound. I do music recording. got this for vocals. spend a few more dollars and get a nicer one. I picked up a AT2020 (Audio Technica) and the sound quality was way better.

We use two of these as ambient (background or atmosphere sound) microphones for our streaming of church services. Our church is quite large and the output from our Sennheiser mic while fine sounded muddy, not very clear. We needed something that would pick up congregation voices better. The reviews for the Marantz mic that we saw were for podcast use or similar … would these be the ticket with their large condenser capsule?What a wonderful addition they have been. Very clear and sensitive. And affordable for our church. Very well made, work well. Look great too! We have each mic mounted on a 5’ mic stand, up front either side of our church, facing the congregation. Audio is fed from the included cables through our LyxPro audio snakes and LyxPro cables back to the soundboard, that provide the Phantom Power that the mics need.Looking for an ambient mic, or something that is very sensitive (had to turn down the gain and sliders on our Yorkville soundboard). Really a super value and a great buy. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewTitle: Really good mic, especially for this price
reviews.reviewText: Really good mic, improved the quality of my streaming setup

reviews.reviewTitle: pour les voix qui ont par ailleurs de la profondeur, rendu pas criard.
reviews.reviewText: + ce micro est quasi plus sensible que l'oreille. j'entend enfin toute la palette de notes de ma voix, et j'ai une voix qui a une composante assez basse (on m'entend pas mal même si je fredonne un air).+ bon, je ne suis pas un pro mais ce micro a vraiment un très bon rendu. le côté cardioïde est pas trop mal, ça ne supprime pas totalement les sons latéraux mais rien ne vaudra un traitement audio après, l'important est que ce micro sache bien entendre ce qui se passe (ps: Nvidia RTX Voice ou Nvidia Broadcast sera PARFAIT pour ce micro ! un rien rend ce micro parfait pour stream, chant, etc.+ trépied, shock mount, câble XLR et boîte de rangement excellente transportable facile à re-ranger+ câble XLR épais & connections très bien/proprement soudées (protégées sans êtres noyées dans de la colle mais sous gaine amovible), excellente qualité de construction, bons connecteurs.- points négatifs- pour le prix payé à l'époque, clairement une belle affaire. pour l'économie, un filtre pop vaut le coup d'être rajouté aux achats. et passer à un bras articulé, quand même. les accessoires de base sont bien au fond.mais soyons honnêtes, même si le trépied de base est de qualité, attention à ne pas heurter la table avec quoique ce soit, ça s'entendra vite. (nvidia broadcast fera des merveilles en télétravail)un sacré plaisir que de chanter de tout avec une voix medium-basse ! si votre voix est différente, je pense que ça ira aussi. un pti tour sur youtube à l'international et vous aurez l'oreille pour entendre ce qu'il donne. un rapport qualité-prix vraiment imbattable (probablement la première fois que je dis ça d'un produit).acheté le 31 août 2022 à 49.99€PS: oui, la tech du micro et le XLR sont vraiment un grand +

Für eine gute Freundin habe ich ein günstiges Mikrofon gesucht, das nicht nur für Online-Chat, Streaming, usw. ausreicht, sondern auch mal für Aufnahmen von Gesang und Akustikgitarre. Gerade der letzte Punkt war entscheident für die Wahl eines Kondensatormikrofons, da hier mit einem dynamischen nicht wirklich viel geht. Normal bewege ich mich bei Mikrofonen in einer anderen Liga (Audio Technica 40er Reihe, Neumann TLM, etc.), von den günstigeren hatten mich bisher nur das Audio Technica 4040, Sennheiser MK4 und im untersten Einstiegsbereich das Audio Technica 2020 überzeugen können. Viele anderen Mikrofone in diesen Bereichen haben eine unnatürliche Präsenzanhebung und/oder klingen eher harsch, wie z.B. das Rode NT1a. Zudem liegen diese alle oberhalb des in diesem Fall recht engen BudgetrahmensBei meiner Suche bin ich dann über das Marantz MPM gestolpert. Marantz kannte ich bisher nur aus dem HiFi-Sektor und obwohl das Mikrofon bereits seit 2017 auf dem Markt ist, hatte ich das bisher nicht mitbekommen. Es folgte Lesen von Reviews, Hören von Soundvergleichen auf Youtube, usw. und durch den so entstandenen, doch recht positiven Eindruck schlussendlich die Bestellung. Zur Not kann man es ja eh wieder zurückschicken, dachte ich mir. Nachdem beim ersten Bestellversuch das Paket unterwegs beschädigt wurde, kam nach dem zweiten ein schöner, handlicher Karton bei mir an. Nach dem Öffnen gab er den Blick auf den Inhalt frei: Das Mikrofon, eine Mikrofonspinne, ein kleines Dreibein-Tischstativ mit Gewindeadapter, ein Windschutz aus Schaumstoff und ein XLR-Kabel. Alle enthaltenen Teile bis auf das Kabel (Noname Stecker) machen einen sehr ordentlichen und wertigen Eindruck, insbesondere das Mikrofon fühlt sich in der Hand trotz des geringen Gewichts sehr viel teuerer an.Also erstmal den Gewindeadapter vom Stativ und fest in die Spinne einschrauben, die Spinne auf auf das Stativ schrauben, das Mikrofon einsetzen und dann mit dem Kabel ab an mein RME Fireface. Noch kurz die Phantomspeisung aktivieren und... was ich dann hörte war wirklich überraschend gut. Das Mikrofon klingt stellenweise ein bischen wie das deutlich teuerere Rode NT1a, ist aber im Präsenzbereich nicht so überbetont und klingt insgesamt ausgeglichener, wie das AT2020. Das Eigenrauschen ist natürlich nicht auf dem Niveau des Rode, aber im Betrieb völlig unauffällig. Sowohl der Test mit meiner Akustikgitarre, als auch Stimme produzierte ordentliche Ergebnisse, wobei mir aufgefallen ist, daß der Nahbesprechungseffekt deutlich geringer ausfällt, als bei anderen Mikrofonen. Das kann durchaus von Vorteil sein, aber für den typisch bassigen Sound a la Sprecherstimme muss man dafür sehr nah an die Kapsel. Der Windschutz macht seinen Job, ich würde hier aber trotzdem einen Popschutz empfehlen oder das Mikrofon bei ausreichendem Abstand ganz ohne betreiben. Das Signal des MPM ist leiser als das des NT1a und AT2020, benötigt dadurch etwas mehr Gain am Preamp, dafür lässt es sich mit 9-48 Volt speisen, was insbesondere dann praktisch ist, wenn der entsprechende Vorverstärker nicht genug Spannung liefert, wie das bei einigen Interfaces oder älteren Mischpulten (z.B. Fostex 812/820) der Fall ist. Die Aufhängung der Spinne ist etwas straff, so kann stärkerer Trittschall u.U. nicht ganz verhindert werden, aber für den durchschnittlichen Einsatz sollte sie ausreichen. Die Innenseite ist mit einer weichen Schicht beklebt (vermutlich Filz), damit das Mikrofon nicht verkratzt wird.Der Gesamteindruck ist durchwegs positiv, Oberflächenfinish und Korb des MPM wirken edel, der recht neutrale Klang und die Auflösung sind für diese Preisklasse wirklich toll. Bereits mit minimalem Eingriff am EQ und etwas Hall konnte ich sowohl mit Stimme als auch Akustikgitarre sehr ansprechende Ergebnisse erzielen, die durchaus auch für professionelle Zwecke ausreichen und das für nicht einmal 50 Euro. Dabei bekommt man auch noch eine vernünftige Spinne dazu und kann zur Not mit dem kleinen Dreibeinstativ und dem billigen Kabel sofort loslegen. Mit seinem geringen Eigengewicht dürfte das Mikrofon von jedem (auch günstigen) Stativ oder Mikrofonarm sicher gehalten werden.Wer sich also ein preiswertes Kondensatormikro für Online-Chats, Streaming, Podcast, usw. zulegen möchte, sollte neben den gängigen Kandidaten unbedingt auch das Marantz in die Auswahl aufnehmen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Pro quality sound on a budget
reviews.reviewText: This is a fantastic condenser microphone for its price. It has great tone and is solidly built. I have many microphones, condensers and dynamics etc. In a studio recording environment this mic holds its own against many more expensive condenser microphones. Its clean yet warm sounds gives a noise represntation of the recorded source. Whilst not being totally flat this mic has great frequency response without too much colour and is great for instrument mic scenarios...however it really stands out on vocal applications. When you factor in the price too then anyone podcaster, home studio or professional studio owner really would benefit from having one in the mic collection.
